resources.string:
This is an example of Conway's Game of Life. 
 
Begin by selecting which cells will start the game alive, then press play to watch your world evolve.
Touch the screen to select some cells first!

In the Game of Life, the world is a grid of cells that are dead or alive. 
 
This is a zero-player game.
 
You decide which cells are alive at the start of the game, but when play starts, the world evolves on its own following some simple rules...
A cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies
A live cell with two or three live neighbours survives
A cell with more than three live neighbours dies
A dead cell with exactly three live neighbours comes to life
